title: 114_s3245
content: The Act is titled "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016 supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse leader programs for education support. Authorized Clinical Nurse Specialist Programs are education programs that provide registered nurses with full-time clinical nurse specialist education. The objective is to educate clinical nurse specialists who can effectively provide care to inpatients and outpatients with acute and chronic illness. A Nurse-Managed Clinic is a nurse-practice arrangement managed by advanced practice nurses, providing primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. The National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice amended the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse specialists in addition to nurse anesthetists in certain healthcare settings. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to update various sections to reflect the year 2021. The reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is updated to reflect the year 2021, including amendments to section 871 and section 831 regarding funding and grants for nurse education, practice, quality, and retention. The reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is updated to reflect the year 2021, including amendments to promote career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings and diverse population groups. The reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is updated to promote career advancement for nursing personnel, including LPNs, CNAs, and home health aides, to become baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses. The reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act includes developing and implementing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing to encourage mentoring and specialty development. The reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act includes developing internships and residency programs with accredited schools of nursing to encourage mentoring and specialty development. Subsection (g) is amended to include a nurse-managed health clinic. Subsection (h) is removed.
